title: The Temple of Artemis in Ephesus, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is destroyed by arson.
text: The Temple of Artemis in Ephesus, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is destroyed by arson.

title: Pope Pontian succeeds Urban I as the eighteenth pope.
text: Pope Pontian succeeds Urban I as the eighteenth pope.

title: Diocletian appoints Maximian as Caesar and co-ruler.
text: Diocletian appoints Maximian as Caesar and co-ruler.

title: The 365 Crete earthquake affects the Greek island of Crete with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), causing a destructive tsunami that affects the coasts of Libya and Egypt, especially Alexandria. Many thousands were killed.
text: The 365 Crete earthquake affects the Greek island of Crete with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), causing a destructive tsunami that affects the coasts of Libya and Egypt, especially Alexandria. Many thousands were killed.

title: King Berengar I of Italy and a hired Hungarian army defeats the Frankish forces at Verona. King Louis III is captured and blinded for breaking his oath (see 902).[1]
text: King Berengar I of Italy and a hired Hungarian army defeats the Frankish forces at Verona. King Louis III is captured and blinded for breaking his oath (see 902).[1]

title: Battle of Taillebourg: Louis IX of France puts an end to the revolt of his vassals Henry III of England and Hugh X of Lusignan.
text: Battle of Taillebourg: Louis IX of France puts an end to the revolt of his vassals Henry III of England and Hugh X of Lusignan.

title: Battle of Shrewsbury: King Henry IV of England defeats rebels to the north of the county town of Shropshire, England.
text: Battle of Shrewsbury: King Henry IV of England defeats rebels to the north of the county town of Shropshire, England.

title: The first landing of French troops on the coast of the Isle of Wight during the French invasion of the Isle of Wight.
text: The first landing of French troops on the coast of the Isle of Wight during the French invasion of the Isle of Wight.

title: Eighty Years' War: Battle of Jemmingen: Fernando Álvarez de Toledo, Duke of Alva defeats Louis of Nassau.
text: Eighty Years' War: Battle of Jemmingen: Fernando Álvarez de Toledo, Duke of Alva defeats Louis of Nassau.

title: Qing dynasty regent Dorgon issues an edict ordering all Han Chinese men to shave their forehead and braid the rest of their hair into a queue identical to those of the Manchus.
text: Qing dynasty regent Dorgon issues an edict ordering all Han Chinese men to shave their forehead and braid the rest of their hair into a queue identical to those of the Manchus.

title: The Raid on Málaga takes place during the Anglo-Spanish War.
text: The Raid on Málaga takes place during the Anglo-Spanish War.

title: The Treaty of Passarowitz between the Ottoman Empire, Austria and the Republic of Venice is signed.
text: The Treaty of Passarowitz between the Ottoman Empire, Austria and the Republic of Venice is signed.

title: Russo-Turkish War (1768–74): Russia and the Ottoman Empire sign the Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca ending the war.
text: Russo-Turkish War (1768–74): Russia and the Ottoman Empire sign the Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca ending the war.

title: Battle of Brewster Isand : Patriot minutemen in whaleboats, commanded by Major Joseph Vose, raid Nantasket Point, also known as Little Brewster Island, in Boston Harbor, Massachusetts.
text: Battle of Brewster Isand : Patriot minutemen in whaleboats, commanded by Major Joseph Vose, raid Nantasket Point, also known as Little Brewster Island, in Boston Harbor, Massachusetts.

title: Inauguration of Leopold I of Belgium, first king of the Belgians.
text: Inauguration of Leopold I of Belgium, first king of the Belgians.

title: American Civil War: First Battle of Bull Run: At Manassas Junction, Virginia, the first major battle of the war begins and ends in a victory for the Confederate army.
text: American Civil War: First Battle of Bull Run: At Manassas Junction, Virginia, the first major battle of the war begins and ends in a victory for the Confederate army.

title: In the market square of Springfield, Missouri, Wild Bill Hickok shoots and kills Davis Tutt in what is regarded as the first western showdown.
text: In the market square of Springfield, Missouri, Wild Bill Hickok shoots and kills Davis Tutt in what is regarded as the first western showdown.

title: At Adair, Iowa, Jesse James and the James–Younger Gang pull off the first successful train robbery in the American Old West.
text: At Adair, Iowa, Jesse James and the James–Younger Gang pull off the first successful train robbery in the American Old West.

title: After rioting by Baltimore and Ohio Railroad workers and the deaths of nine rail workers at the hands of the Maryland militia, workers in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, stage a sympathy strike that is met with an assault by the state militia.
text: After rioting by Baltimore and Ohio Railroad workers and the deaths of nine rail workers at the hands of the Maryland militia, workers in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, stage a sympathy strike that is met with an assault by the state militia.

title: Louis Rigolly, a Frenchman, becomes the first man to break the 100 mph (161 km/h) barrier on land. He drove a 15-liter Gobron-Brillié in Ostend, Belgium.
text: Louis Rigolly, a Frenchman, becomes the first man to break the 100 mph (161 km/h) barrier on land. He drove a 15-liter Gobron-Brillié in Ostend, Belgium.

title: The passenger steamer SS Columbia sinks after colliding with the steam schooner San Pedro off Shelter Cove, California, killing 88 people.
text: The passenger steamer SS Columbia sinks after colliding with the steam schooner San Pedro off Shelter Cove, California, killing 88 people.

title: The dirigible Wingfoot Air Express crashes into the Illinois Trust and Savings Building in Chicago, killing 12 people.
text: The dirigible Wingfoot Air Express crashes into the Illinois Trust and Savings Building in Chicago, killing 12 people.

date: Malcolm Campbell becomes the first man to exceed 150 mph (241 km/h) on land. At Pendine Sands in Wales, he drives Sunbeam 350HP built by Sunbeam at a two-7-21
title: way average speed of 150.33 mph (242 km/h).[2]
text: way average speed of 150.33 mph (242 km/h).[2]

title: World War II: Battle of Guam: American troops land on Guam, starting a battle that will end on August 10.
text: World War II: Battle of Guam: American troops land on Guam, starting a battle that will end on August 10.

title: World War II: Claus von Stauffenberg and fellow conspirators are tortured and executed in Berlin, Germany, for the July 20 plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler.
text: World War II: Claus von Stauffenberg and fellow conspirators are tortured and executed in Berlin, Germany, for the July 20 plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler.

title: The United States Senate ratifies the North Atlantic Treaty.
text: The United States Senate ratifies the North Atlantic Treaty.

title: The 7.3-Mw Kern County earthquake strikes Southern California with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing 12 and injuring hundreds.
text: The 7.3-Mw Kern County earthquake strikes Southern California with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing 12 and injuring hundreds.

title: First Indochina War: The Geneva Conference partitions Vietnam into North Vietnam and South Vietnam.
text: First Indochina War: The Geneva Conference partitions Vietnam into North Vietnam and South Vietnam.

title: NS Savannah, the first nuclear-powered cargo-passenger ship, is launched as a showcase for Dwight D. Eisenhower's "Atoms for Peace" initiative.
text: NS Savannah, the first nuclear-powered cargo-passenger ship, is launched as a showcase for Dwight D. Eisenhower's "Atoms for Peace" initiative.

title: Elijah Jerry "Pumpsie" Green becomes the first African-American to play for the Boston Red Sox, the last team to integrate. He came in as a pinch runner for Vic Wertz and stayed in as shortstop in a 2–1 loss to the Chicago White Sox.
text: Elijah Jerry "Pumpsie" Green becomes the first African-American to play for the Boston Red Sox, the last team to integrate. He came in as a pinch runner for Vic Wertz and stayed in as shortstop in a 2–1 loss to the Chicago White Sox.

title: Sirimavo Bandaranaike is elected Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, becoming the world's first female head of government
text: Sirimavo Bandaranaike is elected Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, becoming the world's first female head of government

title: Mercury program: Mercury-Redstone 4 Mission: Gus Grissom piloting Liberty Bell 7 becomes the second American to go into space (in a suborbital mission).
text: Mercury program: Mercury-Redstone 4 Mission: Gus Grissom piloting Liberty Bell 7 becomes the second American to go into space (in a suborbital mission).

title: At 02:56 UTC, astronaut Neil Armstrong becomes the first person to walk on the Moon.
text: At 02:56 UTC, astronaut Neil Armstrong becomes the first person to walk on the Moon.

title: After 11 years of construction, the Aswan High Dam in Egypt is completed.
text: After 11 years of construction, the Aswan High Dam in Egypt is completed.

title: The Troubles: Bloody Friday: The Provisional IRA detonate 22 bombs in central Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom in the space of 80 minutes, killing nine and injuring 130.
text: The Troubles: Bloody Friday: The Provisional IRA detonate 22 bombs in central Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom in the space of 80 minutes, killing nine and injuring 130.

title: In Lillehammer, Norway, Mossad agents kill a waiter whom they mistakenly thought was involved in the 1972 Munich Olympics Massacre.
text: In Lillehammer, Norway, Mossad agents kill a waiter whom they mistakenly thought was involved in the 1972 Munich Olympics Massacre.

title: Christopher Ewart-Biggs, the British ambassador to the Republic of Ireland, is assassinated by the Provisional IRA.
text: Christopher Ewart-Biggs, the British ambassador to the Republic of Ireland, is assassinated by the Provisional IRA.

title: The start of the four-day-long Libyan–Egyptian War.
text: The start of the four-day-long Libyan–Egyptian War.

title: The world's lowest temperature in an inhabited location is recorded at Vostok Station, Antarctica at −89.2 °C (−128.6 °F).
text: The world's lowest temperature in an inhabited location is recorded at Vostok Station, Antarctica at −89.2 °C (−128.6 °F).

title: Third Taiwan Strait Crisis: The People's Liberation Army begins firing missiles into the waters north of Taiwan.
text: Third Taiwan Strait Crisis: The People's Liberation Army begins firing missiles into the waters north of Taiwan.

title: At the conclusion of a fireworks display on Okura Beach in Akashi, Hyōgo, Japan, 11 people are killed and more than 120 are injured when a pedestrian footbridge connecting the beach to JR Asagiri Station becomes overcrowded and people leaving the event fall down in a domino effect.
text: At the conclusion of a fireworks display on Okura Beach in Akashi, Hyōgo, Japan, 11 people are killed and more than 120 are injured when a pedestrian footbridge connecting the beach to JR Asagiri Station becomes overcrowded and people leaving the event fall down in a domino effect.

title: July 2005 London bombings occur.
text: July 2005 London bombings occur.

title: Ram Baran Yadav is declared the first president of Nepal.
text: Ram Baran Yadav is declared the first president of Nepal.

title: NASA's Space Shuttle program ends with the landing of Space Shuttle Atlantis on mission STS-135 at NASA's Kennedy Space Center.
text: NASA's Space Shuttle program ends with the landing of Space Shuttle Atlantis on mission STS-135 at NASA's Kennedy Space Center.

title: Erden Eruç completes the first solo human-powered circumnavigation of the world.
text: Erden Eruç completes the first solo human-powered circumnavigation of the world.
